t: 1 Chronicles 18
David’s Further Conquests
After*p this it came to pass that David attacked the Philistines, subdued them, and took Gath and its towns from the hand of the Philistines.
Then he defeated Moab, and the Moabites became David’s servants, and*i brought tribute.
And*p David defeated Hadadezer king of Zobah as*i far*i as*i Hamath, as he went to establish his power by the River Euphrates.

David took from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. Also David hamstrung all the chariot horses,*i except that he spared enough of them for one hundred chariots.
When*p the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand of the Syrians.
Then David put garrisons*i in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became David’s servants, and*i brought tribute. So the Lord*s preserved David wherever he went.
And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
Also from Tibhath and from Chun, cities of Hadadezer, David brought a large amount of bronze, with which Solomon made the bronze Sea, the pillars, and the articles of bronze.
Now*p when Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,

he sent Hadoram his son to King David, to greet him and bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him (for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou); and Hadoram*i brought*i with*i him*i all kinds of articles of gold, silver, and bronze.

King David also dedicated these to the Lord,*s along with the silver and gold that he had brought from all these*i nations—from Edom, from Moab, from the people of Ammon, from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
Moreover*p Abishai the son of Zeruiah killed eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
He also put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David’s servants. And the Lord*s preserved David wherever he went.
David’s Administration
So*p David reigned over all Israel, and administered judgment and justice to all his people.
Joab the son of Zeruiah was*i over the army; Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was*i recorder;
Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were*i the priests; Shavsha was*i the scribe;
Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was*i over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were*i chief ministers at the king’s side.
